intro: Madia chilensis, commonly known as Chilean madia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are generally linear or lanceolate, and it produces small, yellow to orange flowers that attract pollinators. Madia chilensis is often used in ornamental gardening due to its resilience and aesthetic appeal.
